text.p: True or False: No linear transformation [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^6 \rightarrow \mathbb R^8[/mathjaxinline] can be onto.
True or False: Every linear transformation [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^8 \rightarrow \mathbb R^6[/mathjaxinline] must be onto.

solution.font:
Suppose [mathjaxinline]T: \mathbb R^6 \rightarrow \mathbb R^8[/mathjaxinline] is a linear transformation. From the video, since [mathjaxinline]6<8[/mathjaxinline], [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] cannot be onto.
A linear transformation from [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^8[/mathjaxinline] to [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^6[/mathjaxinline] might be onto, but it might not be. For instance, the map sending everything to [mathjaxinline]\mathbf{0}[/mathjaxinline] is a linear transformation which is not onto.
